description: Enterprise techniques used by BRONZE BUTLER, ATT&CK group G0060 v1.0
name: BRONZE BUTLER (G0060)

techniques.comment: [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) compromised three Japanese websites using a Flash exploit to perform watering hole attacks.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has exploited Microsoft Word vulnerability CVE-2014-4114 for execution.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has attempted to get users to launch malicious Microsoft Word attachments delivered via spearphishing emails.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) used spearphishing emails with malicious Microsoft Word attachments to infect victims.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060)'s MSGET downloader uses a dead drop resolver to access malicious payloads.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has compressed data into password-protected RAR archives prior to exfiltration.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) malware has used HTTP for C2.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used various tools to download files, including DGet (a similar tool to wget).

[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has given malware the same name as an existing file on the file share server to cause users to unwittingly launch and install the malware on additional systems.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) malware xxmm contains a UAC bypass tool for privilege escalation.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has exfiltrated files stolen from file shares.

[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used [at](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0110) and [schtasks](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0111) to register a scheduled task to execute malware during lateral movement.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has collected a list of files from the victim and uploaded it to its C2 server, and then created a new list of specific files to steal.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) downloads encoded payloads and decodes them on the victim.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used a tool to capture screenshots.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used VBS, VBE, and batch scripts for execution.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has compressed and encrypted data into password-protected RAR archives prior to exfiltration.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) downloader code has included "0" characters at the end of the file to inflate the file size in a likely attempt to evade anti-virus detection.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used RC4 encryption (for Datper malware) and AES (for xxmm malware) to obfuscate HTTP traffic.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used various tools to perform credential dumping.
The [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) uploader or malware the uploader uses command to delete the RAR archives after they have been exfiltrated.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used net time to check the local time on a target system.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used a batch script that adds a Registry Run key to establish malware persistence.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has created forged Kerberos Ticket Granting Ticket (TGT) and Ticket Granting Service (TGS) tickets to maintain administrative access.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used net user /domain to identify account information.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) uses the command-line interface.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) typically use ping and [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to enumerate systems.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has exfiltrated files stolen from local systems.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used a tool called RarStar that encodes data with a custom XOR algorithm when posting it to a C2 server.
Several [BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) tools encode data with base64 when posting it to a C2 server.
[BRONZE BUTLER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0060) has used PowerShell for execution.
